intro: Codonocephalum inuloides, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many species with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are often hairy and arranged in a rosette pattern, helping to reduce water loss. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are followed by small, capsule-like fruits.
